functions.name: first_three_numbers_below_target
functions.description: This function returns the first three numbers in an array that are below a given target value
functions.signature: int* first_three_numbers_below_target(int* arr, int size, int target)

input_parameters.name: size
input_parameters.description: The size of the input array

input_parameters.name: target
input_parameters.description: The target value to compare array elements against

return_values.value: pointer to array of first three numbers below target
return_values.name: result

return_values.description: If there are less than three numbers below target in the array
return_values.name: result

edge_cases: Less than three numbers below target
functions.body: Iterate over the array. For each element, if it is less than the target, add it to the result. Stop when three numbers have been found or the end of the array is reached.
